verses.verse: Woe <WH1945> to the bloody <WH1818> city! <WH5892> it is all <WH3605> full <WH4392> of lies <WH3585> and robbery; <WH6563> the prey <WH2964> departs <WH4185> not;

The noise <WH6963> of a whip, <WH7752> and the noise <WH6963> of the rattling <WH7494> of the wheels, <WH212> and of the prancing <WH1725> horses, <WH5483> and of the jumping <WH7540> chariots. <WH4818>

The horseman <WH6571> lifts <WH5927> up both the bright <WH3851> sword <WH2719> and the glittering <WH1300> spear: <WH2595> and there is a multitude <WH7230> of slain, <WH2491> and a great <WH3514> number of carcasses; <WH6297> and there is none <WH369> end <WH7097> of their corpses; <WH1472> they stumble <WH3782> on their corpses: <WH1472>

Because of the multitude <WH7230> of the prostitutions <WH2183> of the well favored <WH2896> <WH2580> harlot, <WH2181> the mistress <WH1172> of witchcrafts, <WH3785> that sells <WH4376> nations <WH1471> through her prostitutions, <WH2183> and families <WH4940> through her witchcrafts. <WH3785>

Behold, <WH2005> I am against <WH413> you, said <WH5002> the LORD <WH3068> of hosts; <WH6635> and I will discover <WH1540> your skirts <WH7757> on your face, <WH6440> and I will show <WH7200> the nations <WH1471> your nakedness, <WH4626> and the kingdoms <WH4467> your shame. <WH7036>
And I will cast <WH7993> abominable <WH8251> filth on you, and make you vile, <WH5034> and will set <WH7760> you as a spectacle. <WH7210>

And it shall come <WH1961> to pass, that all <WH3605> they that look <WH7200> on you shall flee <WH5074> from you, and say, <WH559> Nineveh <WH5210> is laid waste: <WH7703> who <WH4310> will bemoan <WH5110> her? from where <WH370> shall I seek <WH1245> comforters <WH5162> for you?

Are you better <WH3190> than populous <WH527> No, <WH4996> that was situate <WH3427> among the rivers, <WH2975> that had the waters <WH4325> round <WH5439> about it, whose <WH834> rampart <WH2426> was the sea, <WH3220> and her wall <WH2346> was from the sea? <WH3220>
Ethiopia <WH3568> and Egypt <WH4714> were her strength, <WH6109> and it was infinite; <WH7097> Put <WH6316> and Lubim <WH3864> were your helpers. <WH5833>

Yet <WH1571> was she carried <WH1473> away, <WH1473> she went <WH1980> into captivity: <WH7628> her young children <WH5768> also <WH1571> were dashed <WH7376> in pieces at the top <WH7218> of all <WH3605> the streets: <WH2351> and they cast <WH3032> lots <WH1486> for her honorable <WH3513> men, and all <WH3605> her great <WH1419> men were bound <WH7576> in chains. <WH2131>
You also <WH1571> shall be drunken: <WH7937> you shall be hid, <WH5956> you also <WH1571> shall seek <WH1245> strength <WH4581> because of the enemy. <WH341>

All <WH3605> your strong <WH4013> holds <WH4013> shall be like fig <WH8384> trees with the first ripe <WH1063> figs: if <WH518> they be shaken, <WH5128> they shall even fall <WH5307> into <WH5921> the mouth <WH6310> of the eater. <WH398>

Behold, <WH2009> your people <WH5971> in the middle <WH7130> of you are women: <WH802> the gates <WH8179> of your land <WH776> shall be set wide <WH6605> open <WH6605> to your enemies: <WH341> the fire <WH784> shall devour <WH398> your bars. <WH1280>

Draw <WH7579> you waters <WH4325> for the siege, <WH4692> fortify <WH2388> your strong <WH4013> holds: <WH4013> go <WH935> into clay, <WH2916> and tread <WH7429> the mortar, <WH2563> make strong <WH2388> the brick kiln. <WH4404>

There <WH8033> shall the fire <WH784> devour <WH398> you; the sword <WH2719> shall cut <WH3772> you off, it shall eat <WH398> you up like the cankerworm: <WH3218> make yourself many <WH3513> as the cankerworm, <WH3218> make yourself many <WH3513> as the locusts. <WH697>
You have multiplied <WH7235> your merchants <WH7402> above the stars <WH3556> of heaven: <WH8064> the cankerworm <WH3218> spoils, <WH6584> and flees <WH5775> away.

Your crowned <WH4502> are as the locusts, <WH697> and your captains <WH2951> as the great <WH1462> grasshoppers, <WH1462> which camp <WH2583> in the hedges <WH1448> in the cold <WH7135> day, <WH3117> but when the sun <WH8121> rises <WH2224> they flee <WH5074> away, and their place <WH4725> is not known <WH3045> where <WH335> they are.

Your shepherds <WH7462> slumber, <WH5123> O king <WH4428> of Assyria: <WH804> your nobles <WH117> shall dwell <WH7931> in the dust: your people <WH5971> is scattered <WH6340> on the mountains, <WH2022> and no <WH369> man gathers <WH6908> them.

There is no <WH369> healing <WH3545> of your bruise; <WH7667> your wound <WH4347> is grievous: <WH2470> all <WH3605> that hear <WH8085> the bruit <WH8088> of you shall clap <WH8628> the hands <WH3709> over <WH5921> you: for on whom <WH4310> has not your wickedness <WH7451> passed <WH5674> continually? <WH8548>
